result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera

defendant.name: Rivera-Rivera, Jessy Omar
defendant.address: 2423 West Mitchell Street # A, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera. Kevin Clancy, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in quarantine, appearance is waived. Case is calendared for a plea hearing, parties are pursuing a global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requested projected plea date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Plea hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared in court in person for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel informs the court that the Defendant wants to waive the Preliminary Hearing. Due to court congestion, waiver unable to proceed. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody at HOC.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. HOC unable to produce defendant due to technical issues in the COVID pod. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CBC,; DWC,; MSS,; or MES,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia. Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Due to nature of offense in Counts 1 and 3, a sample of DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample, they should do so.  There are circumstances that the defendant can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
